subject: Career
title: Managing Up: Communicating with Your Boss
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Managing Up: Communicating with Your Boss.

hook.text: Your boss doesn't read your weekly update. She reads 50 others. The problem isn't her â€” it's your format.

buildup.text: Managing up means adapting your communication to your manager's preferences and constraints.

discovery.text: Some managers want details. Others want headlines. Know which type and deliver accordingly.

twist.text: The biggest mistake: bringing problems without solutions. Managers value people who think before they escalate.

climax.text: Format: 'Here's the situation. Here's what I recommend. Here's what I need from you.' Concise and actionable.

punchline.text: Make your boss's job easier and your career gets easier.

quiz.question: What does 'managing up' mean in workplace communication?
options: Adapting communication to your manager's preferences and constraints
Telling your boss what to do
